title: Aero-LLM
subtitle: Distributed Framework for Secure UAV Communication with LLMs
description: Distributed framework for secure UAV communication and intelligent decision-making using fine-tuned LLMs (OPT/Llama2) with SFT and RLHF. Achieved >82% accuracy in SITL/HITL environments. Published at IEEE ICCCN 2024.

body.title: Research Motivation
paragraphs: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) face critical challenges in secure communication and autonomous decision-making in dynamic, adversarial environments where traditional rule-based systems fail to adapt.
Existing UAV communication protocols lack the intelligence to recognize security threats, make context-aware decisions, and coordinate effectively in real-time without human intervention.

body.title: Technical Implementation
paragraphs: Led research team in designing and implementing the complete architecture of Aero-LLM, a distributed framework that integrates Large Language Models for secure UAV communication and intelligent decision-making.
Collected comprehensive training data using software-in-the-loop (SITL) and hardware-in-the-loop (HITL) simulation environments, capturing realistic UAV communication patterns and security scenarios.

Fine-tuned several OPT and Llama-2 LLMs using both Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF), optimizing model performance for UAV-specific tasks and enhanced decision-making capabilities.
Conducted extensive experiments across multiple model configurations, systematically evaluating accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 scores with minimal error rates.

body.title: Results & Impact
paragraphs: Achieved high accuracy (>82%), precision, recall, and F1 scores with minimal error rates across comprehensive test scenarios involving UAV communication and security challenges.
Successfully demonstrated the framework's ability to detect and respond to security threats in real-time, enabling autonomous UAV decision-making without compromising mission objectives.

Co-authored research paper published at ICCCN 2024: IEEE's 33rd International Conference on Computer Communications and Networks, 1st International Workshop on Integrated Sensing, Communication, and Computing (IoT Systems).
Established a foundation for next-generation intelligent UAV systems that can adapt to dynamic environments, coordinate securely, and make autonomous decisions using natural language understanding.
